column4: to quote an op here and on #debian, bob2, the main difference is that ubuntu uses sudo by default. also, to give you some moer information...ubuntu triess to have newer apops, with that release ccyle.
ubuntu is newer, and has a much smaller community,
its called a netsplit, some server dies.

yes
